title: Ctrl+F1 not working on some fields in the help search
description: The Ctrl+F1 keyboard shortcut is not functioning as expected in the Help Search on certain fields.
OB: When using Ctrl+F1 on the first text field in the Help Search, no help pop-up screen is displayed.
EB: When pressing Ctrl+F1 on any text field in the Help Search, a help pop-up screen should appear, displaying relevant information about the Help Search.
SR:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch Eclipse with DBCS locale.
2. Select 'Search Help' from the menu bar.
3. In the pop-up window, click on the first text field.
4. Press Ctrl+F1.

Expected Result:
A help pop-up screen should appear, displaying information about the Help Search.

Actual Result:
Nothing happens.

Comments:
1. This issue occurs on all DBCS languages.
2. The problem is specific to the first text field; when cycling through other fields using the tab key, Ctrl+F1 works correctly, displaying the correct text.
3. Refer to the attached screenshot for a visual indication of the field that is not responding to Ctrl+F1 (circled in red), while fields that work properly are circled in green.
